Established in 1992, Kings Guards has continued to offer quality and total security solutions to its numerous clients spread across the length and breath of the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Manager - Operations

Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT) and Lagos

Requirements


	Minimum of First Degree / HND qualification&nbsp;from a reputable tertiary institution.
	Minimum of 5 years of work experience in an industrial security organization.
	Age range: 30 - 45 years old.
	Must be able to drive and possess a valid driver&#39;s license
	Ability to speak Hausa language is an added advantage for Abuja applicants
	Professional Certificate in industrial security (CPO, CSS, HSE, etc.) will be added advantage.


Remuneration
Very Attractive.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application to:&nbsp;kingsguards@kingsguards.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Assistant Manager - Operations Job at Kings Guards Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Kings Guards Nigeria Limited is a well-known brand name in the private industrial security sector in Nigeria. Established in 1992, Kings Guards has continued to offer quality and total security solutions to its numerous clients spread across the length and breath of the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Manager - Operations

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos

Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Minimum of First Degree / HND qualification from a reputable tertiary institution.
	Minimum of 5 years of work experience in an industrial security organization.
	Age range: 30 - 45 years old.
	Must be able to drive and possess a valid driver's license
	Ability to speak Hausa language is an added advantage for Abuja applicants
	Professional Certificate in industrial security (CPO, CSS, HSE, etc.) will be added advantage.


Remuneration
Very Attractive.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application to: kingsguards@kingsguards.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at Tolaram Group
content:
Tolaram is a fast moving consumer goods sector, and we are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Van Sales Representative (Driver Assistant) / Sales Promoter

Job Locations: Bariga, Shomolu and Oshodi - Lagos

Job Summary


	The Van Sales Reprsentative (Driver Assistant) will support the driver in executing daily sales operations, ensuring effective product distribution, and maintaining strong customer relationships. The role involves assisting in loading and offloading goods, collecting payments, and promoting products to meet sales targets.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Assist the driver in route planning, delivery, and product distribution.
	Sell and promote company products to existing and new customers.
	Ensure accurate record-keeping of sales and payments.
	Support in loading, offloading, and proper product display at customer locations.
	Maintain good customer relationships and provide prompt service.


Requirements


	Minimum SSCE qualification.
	Prior experience in sales or distribution is an advantage.
	Good communication and customer service skills.
	Must be reliable, physically fit, and able to work as part of a team.


Salary
N70,000 monthly + N50,000 performance incentive.

Application Closing Date: 10th December, 2025. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: deborah.amana@tolaram.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Head - Aviation (Business Origination, Bidding & Technical Reinsurance Coordination)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Managing Director / Board
Division: Aviation & Special Risks

Role Summary


	The Head – Aviation will lead Mutual Equity Insurance Broking Limited’s aviation portfolio under the Mutual Equity × K.M. Dastur (KMD) partnership.
	The role focuses on driving business origination, managing aviation tenders, and ensuring seamless technical coordination with KMD’s global teams.
	The ideal candidate will possess strong technical reinsurance knowledge, leadership capability, and deep industry connections within Nigeria’s aviation and insurance markets.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute business growth strategies for aviation insurance and reinsurance across Nigeria and West Africa.
	Originate, manage, and negotiate aviation insurance mandates for airlines, airports, and regulatory bodies.
	Lead bid and tender processes—ensuring technical accuracy, compliance, and competitive pricing.
	Coordinate technical documentation, quotations, and facultative placements with KMD’s international teams.
	Review and finalize policy wordings, endorsements, and claims documentation.
	Build and maintain senior relationships with NCAA, FAAN, NAMA, and key aviation stakeholders.
	Lead the Aviation & Technical Executive team, ensuring compliance with NAICOM, NCRIB, and Lloyd’s standards.
	Contribute to board-level planning and drive operational governance for the Aviation vertical.


Candidate Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Insurance, Aeronautical Engineering, Risk Management, or a related field; MBA/ACII/ACIIN preferred.
	Minimum 15 years of experience in aviation insurance/reinsurance, with at least 7 years in a leadership or underwriting role.
	Proven track record managing aviation portfolios, tenders, and client relationships.
	Strong knowledge of Hull, Liability, War, Crew, and Airport risks.
	Experience engaging with international reinsurers, preferably within Lloyd’s markets.
	Excellent leadership, negotiation, and presentation skills with high professional integrity.


Salary
N25,000,000 / Annual (Gross)

Application Closing Date: 12th December, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Head – Oil & Energy (Business Origination, Bidding & Strategic Partnerships)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	The Head – Oil & Energy (O&E) will lead Mutual Equity Insurance Broking Limited’s strategic expansion into the Oil & Energy reinsurance sector in partnership with K.M. Dastur Group (KMD) — a global Lloyd’s-registered specialist broker.
	The role combines business origination, technical reinsurance expertise, and strategic leadership to drive growth, build market visibility, and manage high-level relationships across Nigeria’s oil and gas ecosystem.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute strategies to secure Oil & Energy insurance and reinsurance mandates.
	Leverage industry and regulatory relationships to expand business visibility across Nigeria and West Africa.
	Lead bidding and tender processes, ensuring accurate and compliant technical and financial submissions.
	Coordinate with KMD’s global teams for placement strategy, pricing, and reinsurance structuring.
	Build and maintain senior relationships with key industry stakeholders (NNPC, NUPRC, IOCs, NOCs, etc.).
	Establish and lead an Oil & Energy business unit, mentoring staff and ensuring compliance with NAICOM, NCRIB, and Lloyd’s standards.


Candidate Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Insurance, Petroleum, Engineering, or Business Administration; ACII/ACIIN or MBA preferred.
	Minimum of 15 years in insurance/reinsurance, including at least 7 years managing Oil & Energy portfolios.
	Proven expertise in bid management, insurance placement, reinsurance structuring, and client engagement.
	Strong relationships within Nigeria’s oil & gas and insurance sectors.
	Excellent leadership, negotiation, and communication skills.


Salary
N50,000,000 annual gross.

Application Closing Date: 5th December, 2025.

Click here to apply online

     

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Personal Assistant",
  "description": "FMR Agency is an end to end HR Company in Nigeria placing quality candidates to quality Companies alongside other services. This time, our client in the REAL ESTATE industry is looking for a well experienced and competent Sales Representative.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant
Job Location:&nbsp;Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time (Hybrid &ndash; 3 Days Onsite Weekly)

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Personal Assistant to provide high-level executive and administrative support within a consulting and marketing environment.
	The ideal candidate will excel in guest relations, executive coordination, communication, scheduling, and multitasking while maintaining a high level of professionalism.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide executive support and coordinate daily administrative tasks.
	Manage calendars, appointments, and travel logistics.
	Deliver excellent guest and client service in person and virtually.
	Assist with documentation, reports, and presentations.
	Handle correspondence, calls, and follow-ups professionally.
	Support in organizing meetings, briefings, and events.
	Maintain confidentiality and ensure smooth workflow for the executive.
	Perform basic financial or legal administrative tasks where applicable.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree from a recognized institution
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Strong multitasking and time management abilities
	High level of organization and attention to detail
	Professional appearance and demeanor


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send CV to:&nbsp;L.recruiter@fmragency.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Personal Assistant Job at FMR Agency




        
    

        
        FMR Agency is an end to end HR Company in Nigeria placing quality candidates to quality Companies alongside other services. This time, our client in the REAL ESTATE industry is looking for a well experienced and competent Sales Representative.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant
Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time (Hybrid – 3 Days Onsite Weekly)

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Personal Assistant to provide high-level executive and administrative support within a consulting and marketing environment.
	The ideal candidate will excel in guest relations, executive coordination, communication, scheduling, and multitasking while maintaining a high level of professionalism.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide executive support and coordinate daily administrative tasks.
	Manage calendars, appointments, and travel logistics.
	Deliver excellent guest and client service in person and virtually.
	Assist with documentation, reports, and presentations.
	Handle correspondence, calls, and follow-ups professionally.
	Support in organizing meetings, briefings, and events.
	Maintain confidentiality and ensure smooth workflow for the executive.
	Perform basic financial or legal administrative tasks where applicable.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree from a recognized institution
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Strong multitasking and time management abilities
	High level of organization and attention to detail
	Professional appearance and demeanor


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send CV to: L.recruiter@fmragency.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Growth Product Manager",
  "description": "Software Business Solutions Consulting (SBSC) is a boutique, minority-owned and managed, consulting firm, working with global clients to uncover opportunities and solve problems. We are experts in the areas of: Application Development, Application Support, Business Strategy, Program &amp; Project Management, Business Intelligence, Mobile Application, and Help Desk/Customer Service. We use this expertise and our experience in various industries, such as Healthcare, Financial Services, Retail, Travel, Transport, Logistics and Insurance, to provide results that businesses need.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Growth Product Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;

Job Overview


	The Product Growth &amp; Success Manager will play a pivotal role in driving the success of SBSC&rsquo;s proprietary products from launch to market maturity. This individual will serve as the key link between the engineering, sales, and management teams, ensuring seamless communication, product-market alignment, and customer satisfaction.
	The role requires a blend of product management, customer success, and business development skills to ensure that SBSC&rsquo;s products not only meet market needs but also deliver consistent revenue growth and client satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
Product Coordination &amp; Lifecycle Management:


	Serves as the primary liaison between engineering, sales, and management teams to ensure alignment on product goals, updates, and timelines.
	Understands the product roadmap and ensure milestones are achieved from development through rollout and scaling.
	Translates technical updates into business language for internal and external communication.
	Supports feature prioritization based on client feedback and market demand.


Market Readiness &amp; Go-to-Market Execution:


	Collaborates with sales and marketing teams to design and execute product launch strategies.
	Supports the creation of product pitch materials, demos, and client-facing documentation.
	Conducts market and competitor analysis to identify positioning opportunities.
	Trains internal teams on product features, value propositions, and differentiators.


Client Engagement &amp; Account Management:


	Manages end-to-end client onboarding and ensure a smooth transition from demo to full adoption.
	Maintains regular communication with clients to gather feedback and track satisfaction.
	Identifies upselling and cross-selling opportunities within existing accounts.
	Addresses client issues in collaboration with the engineering and support teams, ensuring timely resolution.


Revenue Growth &amp; Product Performance:


	Tracks product performance metrics including revenue, adoption rate, churn, and client satisfaction.
	Works with finance and sales teams to forecast revenue and monitor performance against targets.
	Recommends strategies to improve customer retention and maximize profitability.


Reporting &amp; Continuous Improvement:


	Provides regular updates to management on product performance, challenges, and opportunities.
	Proactively identifies bottlenecks and process improvements for product delivery and client success.
	Supports documentation of lessons learned, success stories, and market insights.


Key Skills and Competencies:


	Strong understanding of the software product lifecycle - from ideation and development to launch and growth.
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
	Business acumen with the ability to translate technical concepts into business value.
	Customer-focused mindset with proven problem-solving and follow-up ability.
	Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
	Ability to multitask and manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.


Requirements
Qualifications:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, Marketing, or a related field.
	A postgraduate degree (MBA or equivalent) is an added advantage.
	Professional certification in Product Management, Business Analysis, or Customer Success will be a plus.


Experience:


	3&ndash;5 years of relevant experience in product management, customer success, business analysis, or account management in a technology or software company.
	Proven track record of working with cross-functional teams (engineering, sales, and marketing).
	Experience supporting SaaS, enterprise, or custom software solutions preferred.
	Demonstrated success in improving product adoption, client retention, and revenue growth.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;oaina@sbsc.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Growth Product Manager Job at Software Business Solutions Consulting




        
    

        
        Software Business Solutions Consulting (SBSC) is a boutique, minority-owned and managed, consulting firm, working with global clients to uncover opportunities and solve problems. We are experts in the areas of: Application Development, Application Support, Business Strategy, Program & Project Management, Business Intelligence, Mobile Application, and Help Desk/Customer Service. We use this expertise and our experience in various industries, such as Healthcare, Financial Services, Retail, Travel, Transport, Logistics and Insurance, to provide results that businesses need.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Growth Product Manager

Job Location: Lagos 
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Overview


	The Product Growth & Success Manager will play a pivotal role in driving the success of SBSC’s proprietary products from launch to market maturity. This individual will serve as the key link between the engineering, sales, and management teams, ensuring seamless communication, product-market alignment, and customer satisfaction.
	The role requires a blend of product management, customer success, and business development skills to ensure that SBSC’s products not only meet market needs but also deliver consistent revenue growth and client satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
Product Coordination & Lifecycle Management:


	Serves as the primary liaison between engineering, sales, and management teams to ensure alignment on product goals, updates, and timelines.
	Understands the product roadmap and ensure milestones are achieved from development through rollout and scaling.
	Translates technical updates into business language for internal and external communication.
	Supports feature prioritization based on client feedback and market demand.


Market Readiness & Go-to-Market Execution:


	Collaborates with sales and marketing teams to design and execute product launch strategies.
	Supports the creation of product pitch materials, demos, and client-facing documentation.
	Conducts market and competitor analysis to identify positioning opportunities.
	Trains internal teams on product features, value propositions, and differentiators.


Client Engagement & Account Management:


	Manages end-to-end client onboarding and ensure a smooth transition from demo to full adoption.
	Maintains regular communication with clients to gather feedback and track satisfaction.
	Identifies upselling and cross-selling opportunities within existing accounts.
	Addresses client issues in collaboration with the engineering and support teams, ensuring timely resolution.


Revenue Growth & Product Performance:


	Tracks product performance metrics including revenue, adoption rate, churn, and client satisfaction.
	Works with finance and sales teams to forecast revenue and monitor performance against targets.
	Recommends strategies to improve customer retention and maximize profitability.


Reporting & Continuous Improvement:


	Provides regular updates to management on product performance, challenges, and opportunities.
	Proactively identifies bottlenecks and process improvements for product delivery and client success.
	Supports documentation of lessons learned, success stories, and market insights.


Key Skills and Competencies:


	Strong understanding of the software product lifecycle - from ideation and development to launch and growth.
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
	Business acumen with the ability to translate technical concepts into business value.
	Customer-focused mindset with proven problem-solving and follow-up ability.
	Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
	Ability to multitask and manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.


Requirements
Qualifications:


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, Marketing, or a related field.
	A postgraduate degree (MBA or equivalent) is an added advantage.
	Professional certification in Product Management, Business Analysis, or Customer Success will be a plus.


Experience:


	3–5 years of relevant experience in product management, customer success, business analysis, or account management in a technology or software company.
	Proven track record of working with cross-functional teams (engineering, sales, and marketing).
	Experience supporting SaaS, enterprise, or custom software solutions preferred.
	Demonstrated success in improving product adoption, client retention, and revenue growth.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: oaina@sbsc.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
